ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: What a fabulous course!! I think this course improved my creative writing skills. It also helped me understand what makes something a cultural critique, and how to use personal narrative and academic research to talk about complex issues in creative ways.
I learned a number of techniques and tools, both at the conceptual and sentence level, for writing engaging nonfiction writing.
A better understanding of my voice as a writer and a good introduction to cultural critique.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This has been one of my favorite courses at Yale! Very strong all around.

Professor Shirkhani is an amazing discussion leader and teacher of writer. She is excellent at engaging with student's thoughts, but also makes sure to guide conversation to the key sections of the readings. The only improvement I might suggest is that perhaps the syllabus could be distinguished a little more from ENGL 120? I imagine quite some students take both classes, and a number of readings pop up on both.

Strengths: Prof. Shirkhani was an absolute gem. So supportive and understanding of the stress we are under as students. Always available to meet one-on-one.

Weaknesses: I wish we were able to get some more in-class writing exercises as I feel like I couldve gotten more valuable feedback.

I really appreciated how much detaield feedback Professor Shirkhani was able to give. Her teaching style is both structured and sympathetic to the immense challenges we faced as students this semester.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I liked that Professor Shirkhani used different discussion formats, including having students send in questions, providing group worksheets, and facilitating regular seminar discussions. It was also wonderful to have such a small class.
Not having a private chat is a good move. I like our use of breakout rooms.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! The readings are great and the assignments are challenging but rewarding. Most of all, Professor Shirkhani is an exceptional instructor!
Absolutely. Shirkhani gives the best feedback on writing. If you want to improve your writing this is a brilliant course.
Absolutely, especially if you were a fan of 120.

I would reccomend this course to someone interested in writing personal essays who is prepared to tackle long writing assignments which require a lot of commitment to both style and substance. I would not reccoment this class to someone with a lot of other writing intensive classes; you will get more out of this class if you can focus your writing concentration here and really be able to make use of the professor's feedback.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We also met in person a few times, which was wonderful!!
virtual seminar with a few in-person classes
